Class BaseController

Object
BaseController
Direct Known Subclasses:
ApplicantActionController, ApplicantController, ApplicationManagerController, BookingOfficerController, EnquiryApplicantController, EnquiryManagerController, EnquiryOfficerController, ManagerController, OfficerActionController, OfficerRegistrationManagerController, ProjectManagerController, ReportManagerController, WithdrawalManagerController
public abstract class BaseController extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseController

      public BaseController(IUserService userService, IProjectService projectService, IApplicationService applicationService, IOfficerRegistrationService officerRegistrationService, User currentUser, Scanner scanner, AuthController authController)
      Constructs a new BaseController, initializing shared services and components.
      Parameters:
      userService - Service for user data access.
      projectService - Service for project data access.
      applicationService - Service for application data access.
      officerRegistrationService - Service for officer registration data access.
      currentUser - The currently logged-in User object.
      scanner - Scanner instance for reading user input.
      authController - Controller for authentication tasks (like password change).

  • Method Details

    • findProjectByName

      protected Project findProjectByName(String name)
      Finds a project by its name using the injected project service.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the project to find.
      Returns:
      The Project object if found, null otherwise.

    • findApplicationByApplicantAndProject

      protected BTOApplication findApplicationByApplicantAndProject(String nric, String projectName)
      Finds a BTO application based on the applicant's NRIC and project name using the injected application service.
      Parameters:
      nric - The applicant's NRIC.
      projectName - The project name.
      Returns:
      The BTOApplication object if found, null otherwise.

    • getOfficerHandlingProject

      public Project getOfficerHandlingProject(HDBOfficer officer)
      Determines which active project an HDB Officer is currently approved to handle. Checks the officer registration service for an APPROVED registration and verifies that the corresponding project's application period is still active.
      Parameters:
      officer - The HDBOfficer whose handling project is to be determined.
      Returns:
      The Project object the officer is currently handling and which is active, or null if none.

    • checkDateOverlap

      protected boolean checkDateOverlap(Project p1, Project p2)
      Checks if the application periods of two projects overlap. Handles null projects or dates gracefully (returns false). Overlap occurs if p1's start is not after p2's end AND p1's end is not before p2's start.
      Parameters:
      p1 - The first project.
      p2 - The second project.
      Returns:
      true if the application periods overlap, false otherwise or if data is invalid.

    • getFilteredProjects

      protected List<Project> getFilteredProjects(boolean checkVisibility, boolean checkEligibility, boolean checkAvailability, boolean checkApplicationPeriod, boolean checkNotExpired)
      Retrieves a list of projects based on various filtering criteria. Applies internal controller filters (location, flat type) first. Then applies boolean flags to control checks for visibility, application period activity/expiry, eligibility (based on current user), and unit availability. Sorts the final list by project name.
      Parameters:
      checkVisibility - If true, only includes projects visible to the current user (see isProjectVisibleToCurrentUser(Project)).
      checkEligibility - If true, only includes projects for which the current user is eligible to apply for at least one flat type (see canApplyForFlatType(FlatType)). Ignored for Managers.
      checkAvailability - If true, only includes projects where there is at least one flat type the user is eligible for AND which has available units (> 0). Ignored for Managers. Requires checkEligibility to be meaningful.
      checkApplicationPeriod - If true, only includes projects whose application period is currently active.
      checkNotExpired - If true, only includes projects whose application period has not yet expired.
      Returns:
      A sorted list of Project objects matching all applied filters.

    • isProjectVisibleToCurrentUser

      protected boolean isProjectVisibleToCurrentUser(Project project)
      Determines if a specific project should be visible to the currently logged-in user. - Managers see all projects. - Applicants see projects that are globally visible OR projects they have applied to (and application is not failed/withdrawn). - Officers see projects that are globally visible OR projects they are approved to handle.
      Parameters:
      project - The project to check visibility for.
      Returns:
      true if the project is visible to the current user, false otherwise.

    • canApplyForFlatType

      protected boolean canApplyForFlatType(FlatType type)
      Checks if the currently logged-in user is eligible to apply for a specific flat type based on simplified HDB rules. - Managers cannot apply. - Singles (>= 35) can apply for 2-Room. - Married (>= 21) can apply for 2-Room or 3-Room. (Other statuses like divorced/widowed are not explicitly handled here).
      Parameters:
      type - The FlatType to check eligibility for.
      Returns:
      true if the current user meets the basic criteria for the flat type, false otherwise.

    • applyFilters

      public void applyFilters()
      Prompts the user to enter or clear filters for project location (neighborhood) and flat type. Updates the internal `filterLocation` and `filterFlatType` fields of the controller instance. These filters are used by getFilteredProjects(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean).

    • viewAndSelectProject

      protected void viewAndSelectProject(List<Project> projectList, String prompt)
      Displays a list of projects in a formatted table and prompts the user for common actions (like selection). Shows project details including name, neighborhood, dates, visibility, and flat type information (available/total units, price). For Applicants/Officers, it indicates eligibility ("Ineligible", "No Units") for each flat type. For Managers/Officers, it shows manager NRIC and officer slot usage.
      Parameters:
      projectList - The list of Project objects to display.
      prompt - A title string to display above the project list (e.g., "Select Project to Edit").

    • selectProjectFromList

      protected Project selectProjectFromList(List<Project> projectList)
      Prompts the user to select a project by number from a previously displayed list. Handles user input, validates the choice against the list size, and allows cancellation (input 0).
      Parameters:
      projectList - The list of projects from which the user is selecting.
      Returns:
      The selected Project object, or null if the user cancels, enters invalid input, or the list is empty/null.

    • getIntInput

      protected int getIntInput(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Prompts the user for integer input within a specified range. Reprompts until valid input is received.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display to the user.
      min - The minimum allowed integer value (inclusive).
      max - The maximum allowed integer value (inclusive).
      Returns:
      The validated integer input from the user.

    • getDoubleInput

      protected double getDoubleInput(String prompt, double min, double max)
      Prompts the user for double (floating-point) input within a specified range. Reprompts until valid input is received.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display to the user.
      min - The minimum allowed double value (inclusive).
      max - The maximum allowed double value (inclusive).
      Returns:
      The validated double input from the user.

    • getDateInput

      protected Date getDateInput(String prompt, boolean allowBlank)
      Prompts the user for date input in "yyyy-MM-dd" format. Uses Dparse for parsing and validation. Reprompts until a valid date is entered or if blank input is disallowed.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display to the user.
      allowBlank - If true, allows the user to press Enter to skip input (returns null). If false, requires valid date input.
      Returns:
      The validated Date object, or null if blank input is allowed and entered.
